snippet: The company said that it is beginning “strategic exploratory work” to separate the Nook division to help the e-reader business grow. But a spinoff would raise questions about Barnes & Noble’s ultimate fate.
abstract: The company said that it is beginning “strategic exploratory work” to separate the Nook division to help the e-reader business grow. But a spinoff would raise questions about Barnes & Noble’s ultimate fate.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Considers Spinning Off Its Nook Unit
headline.print_headline: Barnes & Noble May Spin Off E-Reader
